private_information: Can only pick up vowel blocks: A, E, I
Can hold at most one block at a time
vowel_agent.goal: Help achieve the target two-stack configuration A-B-D-E and F-C-I-G by moving only vowel blocks when legal.

private_information: Can only pick up consonant blocks: B, C, D, F, G
Can hold at most one block at a time
consonant_agent.goal: Help achieve the target two-stack configuration A-B-D-E and F-C-I-G by moving only consonant blocks when legal.

orchestrator.goal: Coordinate the vowel_agent and consonant_agent via a PDDL domain and problem that models the initial state, constraints, and final goal, so a valid plan can be generated.

public_information: There are eight labeled blocks: A, B, C, D, E, F, G, I.
Agents may only pick up blocks that are currently the top of a stack.
Each agent can hold at most one block at a time.
An agent cannot place onto a block that is currently held by the other agent.
At most 3 stacks on the table are allowed at any time.
Vowel-agent handles A, E, I. Consonant-agent handles B, C, D, F, G.
Both agents have full knowledge of the state (positions and holdings).

orchestrator.system_prompt: You are an expert in multi-agent PDDL modeling. You will be given the full environment description, agent constraints, and a final goal. Produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem that model two agents (vowel_agent and consonant_agent), their pickup/putdown actions, holding constraints, top-only interaction, the limit on number of stacks, and block-type restrictions. Ensure actions indicate which agent performs them. Return only the PDDL domain enclosed in <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem enclosed in <problem></problem> tags.
orchestrator.prompt:
Your name is orchestrator.
Initial information about the environment: {environment->init}.
Goal for the environment: {environment->goal}.
The public information is: {environment->public_information}.
The vowel_agent's constraints are: {agents->agent_details->vowel_agent->private_information}.
The consonant_agent's constraints are: {agents->agent_details->consonant_agent->private_information}.
Think step by step and provide a PDDL domain and problem that encapsulate the integrated model, respecting the constraints of each agent and the environment. Do not make assumptions beyond the given information. There is no need for anything else beyond producing the pddl files.
